page.title: 03Local History of Hoo
page.content: Hoo was full of troops during {WORLD {WAR 2.}The only bomb that affected Hoo dropped behind Crescent Stores and blew away part of the fence and a gate . Children began work at 13. Most land was owned by the Comports. Then it was sold to Lord Jersey, who sold the land as the sewage was spread on the land and the villagers wouldn't agree to a sewage system. The land was bought and sold to W.H Nicholson. It then went to G.F Armitage. In 1921 the land went to the Brices.Diphteria, Smallpox, Worms and Scarlet Fever were{common diseases .The isolation house is now used as a bungalow. it was built in 1890. The sewage was being collected in buckets in 1950, so bad sanitation was the cause of some illnesses.
